description: Borrowed from Spanish coyote, from a Nahuan language, from Proto-Nahuan *koyootl. Compare Chinook ki-o-tÄ«.

entries.meaning: Canis latrans, a species of canine native to North America.
(US, informal) A smuggler of undocumented immigrants across the land border from Latin America into the United States of America.

verbs.description: coyote (third-person singular simple present coyotes, present participle coyoteing or coyoting, simple past and past participle coyoted)

entries.meaning: To prospect for gold by manually digging holes into overlying earth, as into a hillside.
